content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    lines = split(md, "\n")
    code_blocks = []

    pushfirst!(code_blocks, [])

    for line in lines
        if startswith(line, "#""" && endswith(line, """#") || startswith(line, "```julia"))
            if !isempty(last(code_blocks))
                push!(code_blocks, last(code_blocks) .[1:end-1] .|> String)
            end
            line = replace(line, r"^#+\s*(.+?)\n```\w+\s*$", m -> String(m.match))
            push!(code_blocks, [line])
        elseif !isempty(last(code_blocks)) && !endswith(lines[previndex(Int, findfirst(x -> startswith(x, "#")) > 0, collect(reverse(lines)))) , "```")
            last_code = last(code_blocks)
            push!(last_code, line)
        else
            if !isempty(last(code_blocks))
                push!(code_blocks, last(code_blocks) .[1:end-1] .|> String)
                reset!(code_blocks)
                pushfirst!(code_blocks, [])
            end
        end
    end

    if !isempty(last(code_blocks))
        return join(last(code_blocks)[1:end-1], "\n")
    else
        return ""
    end
end
```
